title: Task 11

question.text: What are whole numbers in the context of programming?

answers.feedback: Whole numbers do not have decimal parts; they are integers like 0, 1, 2, etc.
Whole numbers include all positive integers, negative numbers and zero.
Whole numbers refer to standard numerical digits, not to letters or symbols.

description: Whole numbers are basic numerical data types in programming and mathematics. They are numbers without fractional or decimal parts, including all positive integers (like 1, 2, 3), negative numbers (like -4, -9) and zero (0).
